data.title: Hagerty Non-GAAP EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05, revenue of $357.33M beats by $33.4M
data.description:
• Hagerty press release (HGTY): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.08 beats by $0.05.
  • Revenue of $357.33M (+18.5% Y/Y) beats by $33.4M.
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Total Revenue increased 19% year-over-year to $357 million, and full year 2025 Total Revenue increased 17% year-over-year to $1,456 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Written Premium increased 19% year-over-year to $259 million, and full year 2025 Written Premium increased 14% year-over-year to $1,194 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Commission and fee revenue increased 18% year-over-year to $106 million, and full year 2025 Commission and fee revenue increased 15% year-over-year to $486 million
    • Policies in Force Retention was 88.7% as of December 31, 2025 compared to 89.0% in the prior year period, and total insured vehicles increased 9% year-over-year to 2.8 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Earned Premium increased 14% year-over-year to $193 million, and full year 2025 Earned Premium increased 13% year-over-year to $727 million
  • Fourth quarter 2025 Marketplace revenue increased 80% year-over-year to $29 million, and full year 2025 Marketplace revenue increased 119% year-over-year to $119 million
  • For full year 2026, Hagerty anticipates:
    • Written Premium growth of 15% to 16%
    • Total Revenue change of (12)% to (11)%, as Markel related commission revenue is eliminated under the new fronting arrangement1
    • Net Income of $(51) million to $(41) million, including ~$190 million of pre-tax Markel fronting arrangement transition costs2
    • Adjusted EBITDA of $236 million to $247 million

data.title: Nordic American Tankers GAAP EPS of $0.06, revenue of $21.16M
data.description:
• Nordic American Tankers press release (NAT): Q4 GAAP EPS of $0.06.
  • Revenue of $21.16M (+141.6% Y/Y).
  • The fourth quarter of 2025 produced a Net profit of $11.7 million, compared to the third quarter with a net loss of -$2.8 million.
  • The adjusted EBITDA for the fourth quarter came in at $34.7 million (non-GAAP measure), an improvement of $13.3 million from the third quarter with $21.4 million adjusted EBITDA.
  • The average time charter equivalent (TCE) for our fleet during the fourth quarter of 2025 came in at $35,000 per day per vessel versus $27,490 per day per ship in the third quarter of 2025. These numbers are on a discharge-to-discharge basis.

data.title: Nomad Foods gives Q4 results
data.description:
• Nomad Foods press release (NOMD): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of €0.43.
  • Revenue of €773M (-2.5% Y/Y).
  • Organic revenue declines moderated and retail sell-out accelerated in quarter.
  • Reported revenue decreased 2.6% to €773 million; Organic revenue declined 1.3% with a volume decline of 1.1%
  • Gross margin contracted -290 bps; Adjusted gross margin contracted -240 bps
  • Profit decreased from €51 million to a loss of €11 million, including €57 million of losses net of tax due to refinancing of debt in the quarter; Adjusted EBITDA decreased 4.7% to €131 million
  • Reported Diluted EPS decreased from €0.32 to a loss per share of €0.07, including €0.39 of losses net of tax due to refinancing of debt in the quarter. Adjusted EPS increased 2.4% to €0.43

data.title: Nuvalent GAAP EPS of -$1.58 misses by $0.09
data.description:
• Nuvalent press release (NUVL): Q4 GAAP EPS of -$1.58 misses by $0.09.
  • Cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities were $1.4 billion as of December 31, 2025. Nuvalent continues to believe that its existing cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities will be sufficient to fund its operations into 2029.

data.title: Equinox Gold to launch normal course issuer bid for over 39M shares
data.description:
• Equinox Gold (EQX) announced that the Toronto Stock Exchange has accepted the company’s plans to make a normal course issuer bid to repurchase, for cancellation, up to 39.41M shares.
  • That represents around 5% of the company’s issued and outstanding common shares.
  • Purchases can be made at prevailing market prices during a 12-month period commencing on March 2, 2026 and ending on the earlier of March 1, 2027 and the date on which the company reaches the maximum purchases permitted under the bid.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: Arthur J. Gallagher buys Germany's Krose GmbH
data.description:
• Arthur J. Gallagher (AJG) has acquired Germany-based Krose GmbH & Co KG.
  • Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. Founded in 1920, Krose provides commercial insurance and reinsurance solutions for corporate clients across Germany and specializes in the design and placement of complex programs.
  • Source: Press Release

data.title: NCR Voyix beats top-line and bottom-line estimates; introduces FY26 outlook
data.description:
• NCR Voyix press release (VYX): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.31 beats by $0.02.
  • Revenue of $720M (+6.2% Y/Y) beats by $29.48M.
  • Adjusted EBITDA was $130 million compared to $111 million in the prior year period.
  • Software & Services Revenue was $504 million compared to $517 million in the prior year period.
  • ARR was $1.7 billion compared to $1.6 billion in the prior year period.
  • Software ARR was $783 million compared to $765 million in the prior year period.

  • 2026 Outlook

data.title: Butterfly Network Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.02, revenue of $31.5M
data.description:
• Butterfly Network press release (BFLY): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.02.
  • Revenue of $31.5M (+40.6% Y/Y).

  • Revenue Guidance and Adjusted EBITDA guidance for the Fiscal Year 2026:

    • Revenue of $117 million to $121 million ($110.6M), or approximately 20% to 24% growth
    • Adjusted EBITDA loss of $21 million to $25 million

data.title: American Bitcoin reports FY results
data.description:
• American Bitcoin press release (ABTC): FY net loss of $153.17M.
  • Revenue of $185.16M (+158.8% Y/Y) beats by $18.55M.
